register.name: BT_CLKGEN_ENABLES
register.comment: This register enables the core clocks on the chip. When a corresponding bit is set, the clock is enabled, regardless of any corresponding clock request

register.name: BT_RAWMODE_CONFIG
register.comment: Enables RAW bitstreaming features (for Ant, Zigbee and future devs).

register.name: BT_LLR_TRIGGER_LSW
register.comment: LLR Access Code to transmit or receive LSW

register.name: BT_LLR_TRIGGER_MSW
register.comment: LLR Access Code to transmit or receive MSW

register.name: BT_AES_ACL_CFG_1
register.comment: Enable BT AES and AES CCM modes on ACL packets

register.name: BT_AES_ACL_CFG_2
register.comment: Enable BT AES and AES CCM modes on ACL packets

register.name: BT_AES_ACL_CFG_3
register.comment: Enable BT AES and AES CCM modes on ACL packets

register.name: BT_AES_ACL23_CFG_1
register.comment: Enable BT AES and AES CCM modes on EDR ACL packets

register.name: BT_AES_ACL23_CFG_2
register.comment: Enable BT AES and AES CCM modes on EDR ACL packets

register.name: BT_AES_ACL23_CFG_3
register.comment: Enable BT AES and AES CCM modes on EDR ACL packets

register.name: BT_AES_ACL23_CFG_4
register.comment: Enable BT AES and AES CCM modes on EDR ACL packets

register.name: BT_AES_ESCO_CFG
register.comment: Enable BT AES modes on ESCO packets

register.name: BT_AES_ESCO23_CFG
register.comment: Enable BT AES modes on EDR ESCO packets

register.name: BT_CONFIG_TX
register.comment: BT Config TX on Bitstream processing control

register.name: BT_TX_SW_ABORT
register.comment: Force Tx Bitstream processing abort - Write sensitive

register.name: BT_TX_AUTO_START_TIME
register.comment: Automatically turn on the Tx Bitstream digital at this time when TX_AUTO_START_EN is set.

register.name: BT_TX_DMA_START_TIME
register.comment: Automatically turn on the buf ctrl this number of uS after the auto start when TX_AUTO_START_EN is set.

register.name: BT_CONFIG_RX
register.comment: BT Config RX on Bitstream processing control

register.name: BT_RX_SW_ABORT
register.comment: Force Rx Bitstream processing abort - Write sensitive

register.name: BT_RX_AUTO_START_TIME
register.comment: Automatically turn on the Rx Bitstream digital at this time when RX_AUTO_START_EN is set.

register.name: BT_RX_COEX_ENABLE_STATUS
register.comment: BT RX Enable Status, for Coex

register.name: BT_RX_COEX_EVENT_TYPE_BIT
register.comment: Latched version of event bit, cleared only by explicit coex firmware rst.

register.name: BT_TX_COEX_ENABLE_STATUS
register.comment: BT TX Enable Status, for Coex

register.name: BT_TX_COEX_EVENT_TYPE_BIT
register.comment: Latched version of event bit, cleared only by explicit coex firmware rst.

register.name: BT_TXRX_COEX_ENABLE_STATUS_RST
register.comment: Write sensitive register to clear, enable latch and coex event_bit mirror.

register.name: BT_SPEEDY_RST
register.comment: BT reset on Bitstream processing control

register.name: BT_TX_CORRUPT_CRC
register.comment: Corrupt transmitted CRC by inverting for BLE/BDR/EDR

register.name: BT_TX_PAYLOAD_LENGTH
register.comment: Bluetooth payload length, used by the state machine to seperate from payload_header field changes

register.name: BT_TX_WBREE_SUPP
register.comment: Supplemental field for AoA Data packets.

register.name: BT_TX_WBREE_EXT_HEADER
register.comment: Advertising extensions field and supplemental field for Data packets.

register.name: BT_TX_WBREE_HDR_DATA
register.comment: Wibree tranamit header - this is what is sent on air

register.name: BT_TX_WBREE_LENGTH
register.comment: Seoerate the length field (use for ctrl), in case field moves

register.name: BT_TX_WBREE_CRC_SEED
register.comment: Seed value for Wibree CRC and ICV checksum

register.name: BT_TX_WBREE_HDR_ADV_MASK
register.comment: Wibree transmit common adv extended header decoding masks

register.name: BT_TX_WBREE_HDR_ADV_TYPE_DECODE
register.comment: Wibree transmit common adv extended header type values

register.name: BT_TX_EVENT_TYPE_BIT
register.comment: Latch of Status/Errors of last transmitted packet - each bit corresponds to event type value

register.name: BT_TX_STATE_STATUS_BIT
register.comment: Latch of TX State Status - each bit corresponds to state we've transitioned through

register.name: BT_TX_RAWMODE_LENGTH
register.comment: Length of RAW frame to transmit in bytes (including access code, etc.). For example, a standard fixed frame length should be 18.

register.name: BT_TX_LLR_REPETTIONS
register.comment: Number of times to repeat the LLR Trigger code

register.name: BT_TX_WAIT_FOR_RFIC_DONE
register.comment: Wait for the TxDone acknowledgement to come back from the RFIC before firing the end of packet interrupt

register.name: BT_TX_DATA_FETCH
register.comment: BT Config Data Fetch for TX on Bitstream processing control

register.name: BT_RX_OVERRUN_DISCARD
register.comment: Options for configuring overrrun and discard handling

register.name: BT_RX_STATE
register.comment: Debug register - current state of rx_control

register.name: BT_RX_PAYLOAD_LENGTH_FIELD
register.comment: ctrl to determine length field in received payload header, Reset to standard payload header length field being bits 12:3

register.name: BT_RX_EVENT_CLEAR
register.comment: Write to clear receive event and interrupt without disabling the RX - Write sensitive

register.name: BT_RX_EVENT_TYPE_BIT
register.comment: Received event type - Latch of bits for each error/event type

register.name: BT_RX_STATE_STATUS_BIT
register.comment: Latch of RX State Status - each bit corresponds to state we've transitioned through

register.name: BT_RX_WBREE_HDR_STP
register.comment: Wibree received header SP field decoding

register.name: BT_RX_WBREE_HDR_ADV_MASK
register.comment: Wibree received common adv extended header decoding masks

register.name: BT_RX_WBREE_HDR_ADV_TYPE_DECODE
register.comment: Wibree received common adv extended header type values

register.name: BT_RX_WBREE_LENGTH_FIELD
register.comment: ctrl to determine where to look for length field in received payload header, Reset to standard payload header length field being bits 8:0

register.name: BT_RX_WBREE_SUPP_CRC_FAIL
register.comment: Enable reception of Supplementals on CRC Fail

register.name: BT41_ZL_NONCE_CFG
register.comment: Set zero flag on Rcv Nonce for zero length packets received with following types:

register.name: BT41_SNIFF_MODE
register.comment: Prevent decryption of incoming data stream

register.name: BT_RX_RAWMODE_LENGTH
register.comment: Raw Mode packet length (for receive state machine)

register.name: BT_RX_WAIT_FOR_RFIC_DONE
register.comment: Wait for the RxDone acknowledgement to come back from the RFIC before firing the end of packet interrupt

register.name: BT_RX_DISABLE_RF_PAYLOAD_MSG
register.comment: Option to allow the disabling of the payload length being sent for MLSE/MLE

register.name: BT_RX_SYNC_INT_EN
register.comment: Enable generation of interrupt on Sync

register.name: BT_RX_MLE_ACL_PAYLOAD_DELAY
register.comment: Number of clock cycles to delay sending the ACL payload to the RFIC. This is used to correct a potential timing issue (see SB-17048)

register.name: BT_RX_CRC_HASH
register.comment: Debug - BT or BLE HASH register result on RX, should be 0 on successful packet

register.name: BT_RX_CRC_AIR
register.comment: Debug - BT or BLE CRC received on the AIR for RX

register.name: BT_RX_SOFTDECISION_STATUS
register.comment: Status of soft correction CRC analysis

register.name: BT_TXRX_MASTER_CLOCK
register.comment: Master clock seed for BT encryption LSFR

register.name: BT_TXRX_MASTER_ADDRESS_LSW
register.comment: Master address seed for BT encryption LSFR

register.name: BT_TXRX_MASTER_ADDRESS_MSW
register.comment: Master address seed for BT encryption LSFR

register.name: BT_TXRX_ACCESS_CODE_LAP
register.comment: Lower 24 bits of BT address to generate access code

register.name: BT_TXRX_WHITEN_SEED
register.comment: Whitener seed for BT and Wibree packets

register.name: BT_TXRX_HEC_CRC_SEED
register.comment: Transmit and receive Header Error CRC seed

register.name: BT_TXRX_AES_DBG_ADDR
register.comment: Select data to be read in AES_DBG_DATA

register.name: BT_TXRX_AES_NONCE2[0]
register.comment: AES Additional Nonce to be encrypted

register.name: BT_TXRX_AES_NONCE2[1]
register.comment: AES Additional Nonce to be encrypted

register.name: BT_TXRX_AES_NONCE2[2]
register.comment: AES Additional Nonce to be encrypted

register.name: BT_TXRX_AES_NONCE2[3]
register.comment: AES Additional Nonce to be encrypted

register.name: BT_TXRX_AES_NONCE2[4]
register.comment: AES Additional Nonce to be encrypted

register.name: BT_TXRX_AES_NONCE2[5]
register.comment: AES Additional Nonce to be encrypted

register.name: BT_TXRX_AES_NONCE2[6]
register.comment: AES Additional Nonce to be encrypted

register.name: BT_TXRX_AES_NONCE2[7]
register.comment: AES Additional Nonce to be encrypted

register.name: BT_TXRX_AES_NONCE2[8]
register.comment: AES Additional Nonce to be encrypted

register.name: BT_TXRX_AES_NONCE2[9]
register.comment: AES Additional Nonce to be encrypted

register.name: BT_TXRX_AES_NONCE2[10]
register.comment: AES Additional Nonce to be encrypted

register.name: BT_TXRX_AES_NONCE2[11]
register.comment: AES Additional Nonce to be encrypted

register.name: BT_TXRX_AES_NONCE2[12]
register.comment: AES Additional Nonce to be encrypted

register.name: BT_TXRX_AES_CCM_HDR_EN1
register.comment: Select which bits of header make up B0 key for AES-CCM

register.name: BT_TXRX_AES_CCM_HDR_EN2
register.comment: Select which bits of header make up B0 key for AES-CCM

register.name: BT_TXRX_AES_CONFIG
register.comment: AES config CMM select / Nonce Select

register.name: BT_TXRX_HOP_UAP_LAP
register.comment: Upper and Lower BT address to determine frequecy hopping sequence

register.name: BT_TXRX_HOP_K_SEL
register.comment: K from BT specification, 0: Koffset=24, 1: Koffset=8

register.name: BT_TXRX_HOP_N
register.comment: Number of channels in adapted hop sequence

register.name: BT_TXRX_HOP_F
register.comment: Adapted Hop sequence mapping (F from BT specification)

register.name: BT_TXRX_HOP_INDEX_PRE_MOD
register.comment: Index of required hop before final modulus. Note, value is valid 3 cycles of CPU clock after setting the last input value.

register.name: BT_TXRX_HOP_INDEX
register.comment: Index of required hop (0 to 78 or 0 to 22)

register.name: BT_TXRX_HOP_STATUS
register.comment: New Index register combining both values and a VALID bit

block.name: dma_aes
block.comment: T10 AES control and status registers

register.name: AES_DATA1_ADD
register.comment: DATA 1 (first of the Scatther Gather data sources)address

register.name: AES_DATA2_ADD
register.comment: DATA 2 (Second of the Scatther Gather data sources)address

register.name: AES_DEST1_ADD
register.comment: DEST 1 (first of the Scatther Gather data destination) address

register.name: AES_DEST2_ADD
register.comment: DEST 2 (Second of the Scatther Gather data destination) address

register.name: AES_COMP_REF_ADD
register.comment: The RAM address of Goldern reference , used for BLE privacy nd for CAM operations

register.name: AES_COMP_MASK_ADD
register.comment: The RAM address of Mask for Goldern reference

register.name: AES_COMP_ADD
register.comment: RAM address to store index of a match

register.name: AES_INT_CLEAR
register.comment: Clear Interrupt Sources by writing a 1 to the register bit.

block.name: mif_axi_monitor
block.comment: Monitor transactions on the AXI bus.

register.name: MIF_AXI_MON_MASTER_MASK[0]
register.comment: Bitfield indicating from which bus master(s) to count burst transactions. If multiple bits are set then multiple masters will be counted.

register.name: MIF_AXI_MON_MASTER_MASK[1]
register.comment: Bitfield indicating from which bus master(s) to count burst transactions. If multiple bits are set then multiple masters will be counted.

register.name: MIF_AXI_MON_MASTER_MASK[2]
register.comment: Bitfield indicating from which bus master(s) to count burst transactions. If multiple bits are set then multiple masters will be counted.

register.name: MIF_AXI_MON_MASTER_MASK[3]
register.comment: Bitfield indicating from which bus master(s) to count burst transactions. If multiple bits are set then multiple masters will be counted.

register.name: MIF_AXI_MON_MASTER_MASK[4]
register.comment: Bitfield indicating from which bus master(s) to count burst transactions. If multiple bits are set then multiple masters will be counted.

register.name: MIF_AXI_MON_MASTER_MASK[5]
register.comment: Bitfield indicating from which bus master(s) to count burst transactions. If multiple bits are set then multiple masters will be counted.

register.name: MIF_AXI_MON_MASTER_MASK[6]
register.comment: Bitfield indicating from which bus master(s) to count burst transactions. If multiple bits are set then multiple masters will be counted.

register.name: MIF_AXI_MON_MASTER_MASK[7]
register.comment: Bitfield indicating from which bus master(s) to count burst transactions. If multiple bits are set then multiple masters will be counted.

register.name: MIF_AXI_MON_MASTER_MASK[8]
register.comment: Bitfield indicating from which bus master(s) to count burst transactions. If multiple bits are set then multiple masters will be counted.

register.name: MIF_AXI_MON_MASTER_MASK[9]
register.comment: Bitfield indicating from which bus master(s) to count burst transactions. If multiple bits are set then multiple masters will be counted.

register.name: MIF_AXI_MON_MASTER_MASK[10]
register.comment: Bitfield indicating from which bus master(s) to count burst transactions. If multiple bits are set then multiple masters will be counted.

register.name: MIF_AXI_MON_MASTER_MASK[11]
register.comment: Bitfield indicating from which bus master(s) to count burst transactions. If multiple bits are set then multiple masters will be counted.

register.name: MIF_AXI_MON_MASTER_MASK[12]
register.comment: Bitfield indicating from which bus master(s) to count burst transactions. If multiple bits are set then multiple masters will be counted.

register.name: MIF_AXI_MON_MASTER_MASK[13]
register.comment: Bitfield indicating from which bus master(s) to count burst transactions. If multiple bits are set then multiple masters will be counted.

register.name: MIF_AXI_MON_MASTER_MASK[14]
register.comment: Bitfield indicating from which bus master(s) to count burst transactions. If multiple bits are set then multiple masters will be counted.

register.name: MIF_AXI_MON_MASTER_MASK[15]
register.comment: Bitfield indicating from which bus master(s) to count burst transactions. If multiple bits are set then multiple masters will be counted.

register.name: MIF_AXI_MON_READ_BURST_COUNT
register.comment: Count of the number of read burst transactions on the AXI read channel.

register.name: MIF_AXI_MON_READ_BYTE_COUNT
register.comment: Count of the number of bytes transferred in the read burst transactions on the AXI read channel.

register.name: MIF_AXI_MON_WRITE_BURST_COUNT
register.comment: Count of the number of write burst transactions on the AXI read channel.

register.name: MIF_AXI_MON_WRITE_BYTE_COUNT
register.comment: Count of the number of bytes transferred in the write burst transactions on the AXI write channel.

register.name: MILDRED_SET_PC_HI
register.comment: Set Mildred's PC - upper half. Setting this register causes the update to occur if Mildred is stopped.

register.name: MILDRED_TIMER_COUNTER_PRESCALE_INT
register.comment: Set the integer part of the timer/counter prescaler

register.name: MILDRED_TIMER_COUNTER_PRESCALE_FRAC
register.comment: Set the fractional part of the timer/counter prescaler

register.name: MILDRED_PROGRAM_COUNTER_LO
register.comment: Register view of the Mildred program counter

register.name: MILDRED_PROGRAM_COUNTER_HI
register.comment: Register view of the Mildred program counter

register.name: MILDRED_READ_WRITE_INTERNAL_INT_STATE
register.comment: Clear Mildred's internal interrupt status flops. This is a bitfield register.

register.name: MILDRED_SIU_SDIV
register.comment: Control the SDIV input to the serial interface unit

register.name: MILDRED_PIO_RISING
register.comment: Reads bits 07:00 of the PIO rising edge capture register. When a PIO is high the matching bit is asynchronously set. If low, writing a 1 clears the bit.

register.name: MILDRED_PIO_FALLING
register.comment: Reads bits 07:00 of the PIO falling edge capture register. When a PIO is low the matching bit is asynchronously set. If high, writing a 1 clears the bit.

register.name: RESET
register.comment: Resets for main MXL140 clock generator, WLBT toplevel

register.name: QREQ_OFF_OVR
register.comment: Q-channel request overrides. These are actually clock gate enables to bypass the Q-channel managers.

register.name: RAM_POWER_CONTROL
register.comment: The RAM retention controls for the Core PD processor platform.

register.name: PIO_ALV
register.comment: These control the FEMCTRL output pins if PIO_ALV_EN is set to PIO_ALIVE_EN_PMU.

register.name: CLOCK_MUX_SEL
register.comment: Choose which clock to run the PMU on. This is also the CFG clock.

register.name: MILDRED_RESOURCE_REQ
register.comment: Outgoing resource requests from WLBT to AP/CP. Leave the requests asserted until no longer required.

register.name: MILDRED_TIMER_COUNTER_MUX_SEL
register.comment: Choose the source for timer/counter 0 and 1. 0-15 = PIO[15:0].

register.name: CLOCK_MUX_CFG_SEL
register.comment: Choose which clock to run the CFG interface on.

register.name: CLK_GATE_OVR
register.comment: Clock Gate overrides. Set to '1' to enable the clocks for each of the specified blocks.

register.name: PCH_REQ
register.comment: P-channel manager power down request. Set to '1' to request power down and '0' to power up. Handily inverted logic.

register.name: PCH_ACK
register.comment: P-channel manager power down acknowledge. 1 = powered-down, 0 = powered-up.

register.name: MILDRED_EXT_RESET_REQUEST
register.comment: Requests and status out of WLBT

register.name: SWEEPER_CONTROL
register.comment: Controls the Sweeper modules in WLBT. Set to 1 to start a sweeper clean. Return to 0 once the ACK for that sweeper is set.

register.name: SWEEPER_STATUS
register.comment: Status from the Sweeper modules in WLBT. '1' in a field indicates Sweeper completion.

register.name: MILDRED_AP2WB_REQ
register.comment: Incoming requests from AP to WLBT.

register.name: MILDRED_WB2AP_ACK
register.comment: Outgoing acknowledgement from WLBT to AP.

register.name: CLK_GATE_OVR2
register.comment: Clock Gate overrides. Set to '1' to enable the clocks for each of the specified blocks.

register.name: WATCHDOG_ENABLE
register.comment: Writing '1' enables the watchdog regardless of its previous state and resets its state machine to WATCHDOG_STATUS_FSM_ENABLED.

register.name: WATCHDOG_DISABLE
register.comment: Writing the 3 disable codes in sequence to this register will disable the watchdog. Writing WATCHDOG_DEBUG_CODE3 instead of WATCHDOG_DISABLE_CODE3 will set the watchdog into debug mode. Each correct code written will advance the WATCHDOG_STATUS by 1 until it reaches 3. A status of 3 indicates that the watchdog has been disabled A status of 4 indicates that the watchdog is in debug mode. If an incorrect code is written at any time, the status will revert to 0 (enabled). The watchdog will not stop counting down until all three codes have been written correctly.

register.name: WATCHDOG_KICK
register.comment: Writing to this register causes the countdown value to be reset to the value stored in WATCHDOG_DELAY. WATCHDOG_DELAY is captured into the slow clock domain after a cycle or two. The register fields WATCHDOG_STATUS_KICK_PENDING and WATCHDOG_STATUS_SLOW_KICK_PENDING indicate if this register has already been written and an update is currently pending. Writing this register toggles a flag inside the watchdog logic so writing it a second time before the first has successfully propagated will clear the toggle and cancel the kick.

register.name: PIO_ALV_EN
register.comment: Set to appropriate values to control the source for the FEMCTRL pins.

register.name: PIO_ALV_STATUS
register.comment: FEMCTRL pins status if PIO_ALV_OE_0..3 are set to 0.

register.name: DRCG
register.comment: Dynamic Root Clock gating feature of SLSI blocks. Set to '1' to enable block clock gating. Otherwise the clocks will run all the time.

register.name: PD_CONTROL_PHY
register.comment: Controls the state of switches, isolation and reset in PHY power domain

register.name: PD_CONTROL_CORE
register.comment: Controls the state of switches, isolation and reset in CORE power domain

register.name: PD_STATUS
register.comment: Indicates the status of the switches in each power domain

register.name: MILDRED_PIO_RISING_MASK
register.comment: Bits 07:00 of the PIO rising edge interrupt mask register. The contents of this register are ANDed with MILDRED_P0_RISING and if any bits are 1 an interrupt is raised.

register.name: MILDRED_PIO_FALLING_MASK
register.comment: Bits 07:00 of the PIO falling edge interrupt mask register. The contents of this register are ANDed with MILDRED_P0_FALLING and if any bits are 1 an interrupt is raised.

register.name: SLOW_CLK_TIMER_STATUS_3124
register.comment: A free-running slow clock counter - bits 31-24

register.name: SLOW_CLK_TIMER_STATUS_2316
register.comment: A free-running slow clock counter - bits 23-16

register.name: SLOW_CLK_TIMER_STATUS_1508
register.comment: A free-running slow clock counter - bits 15-8

register.name: SLOW_CLK_TIMER_STATUS_0700
register.comment: A free-running slow clock counter - bits 7-0

register.name: WATCHDOG_DELAY_3124
register.comment: This is the reset value for the watchdog countdown. The reset value is 0xFFFF which allows a countdown period of 2 seconds. The maximum value of 0xFFFFFFFF allows for a sleep time of around 37 hours

register.name: WATCHDOG_DELAY_2316
register.comment: This is the reset value for the watchdog countdown. The reset value is 0xFFFF which allows a countdown period of 2 seconds. The maximum value of 0xFFFFFFFF allows for a sleep time of around 37 hours

register.name: WATCHDOG_DELAY_1508
register.comment: This is the reset value for the watchdog countdown. The reset value is 0xFFFF which allows a countdown period of 2 seconds. The maximum value of 0xFFFFFFFF allows for a sleep time of around 37 hours

register.name: WATCHDOG_DELAY_0700
register.comment: This is the reset value for the watchdog countdown. The reset value is 0xFFFF which allows a countdown period of 2 seconds. The maximum value of 0xFFFFFFFF allows for a sleep time of around 37 hours

register.name: MILDRED_PIO_0700_DRIVE_ENABLE
register.comment: Bits [ 7: 0] of PIO drive enable bus. These 8 PIO drive enable bits are bit-addressable to allow convenient switching for use with e.g. I2C.

register.name: DEEP_SLEEP_PIO_0700_WAKEUP_ENABLES
register.comment: This register enables the PIO[7:0] inputs individually to allow them to create a deep sleep wakeup event.

register.name: DEEP_SLEEP_PIO_0700_WAKEUP_INVERT
register.comment: This register inverts the PIO[7:0] inputs individually before feeding them into the deep sleep wakeup logic. A 1 on the resulting bit may cause a wakeup event.

register.name: DEEP_SLEEP_STATUS_PIO_0700_WAKEUP_STICKY
register.comment: This register returns a sticky version of the PIO[7:0] deep sleep wakeup activities. Clear the sticky activity flops by writing 1 to DEEP_SLEEP_WAKEUP_CLR_PIO.

register.name: DEEP_SLEEP_PIO_1508_WAKEUP_ENABLES
register.comment: This register enables the PIO[15:8] inputs individually to allow them to create a deep sleep wakeup event.

register.name: DEEP_SLEEP_PIO_1508_WAKEUP_INVERT
register.comment: This register inverts the PIO[15:8] inputs individually before feeding them into the deep sleep wakeup logic. A 1 on the resulting bit may cause a wakeup event.

register.name: DEEP_SLEEP_STATUS_PIO_1508_WAKEUP_STICKY
register.comment: This register returns a sticky version of the PIO[15:8] deep sleep wakeup activities. Clear the sticky activity flops by writing 1 to DEEP_SLEEP_WAKEUP_CLR_PIO.

register.name: DEEP_SLEEP_CMD
register.comment: This register is used to trigger events in the sleep block

register.name: DEEP_SLEEP_WAKEUP_ENABLES0
register.comment: This register controls the sources which can cause deep sleep wakeup. Functions are enabled by setting individual bits. Bits are enumerated as DEEP_SLEEP_WAKEUP.

register.name: DEEP_SLEEP_STATUS0
register.comment: This register indicates the currently-active deep sleep wakeup sources.

register.name: DEEP_SLEEP_STATUS_STICKY0
register.comment: This register returns a sticky version of DEEP_SLEEP_STATUS, recording all wakeup events since it was last cleared. Bits are enumerated as DEEP_SLEEP_WAKEUP.

register.name: DEEP_SLEEP_WAKEUP_ENABLES1
register.comment: This register controls the sources which can cause deep sleep wakeup. Functions are enabled by setting individual bits. Bits are enumerated as DEEP_SLEEP_WAKEUP.

register.name: DEEP_SLEEP_STATUS1
register.comment: This register indicates the currently-active deep sleep wakeup sources.

register.name: DEEP_SLEEP_STATUS_STICKY1
register.comment: This register returns a sticky version of DEEP_SLEEP_STATUS, recording all wakeup events since it was last cleared.

register.name: MILDRED_PIO_1508_DRIVE_ENABLE
register.comment: Bits [15: 8] of PIO drive enable bus. These 8 PIO drive enable bits are bit-addressable to allow convenient switching for use with e.g. I2C.

register.name: SLOW_CLK_TIMER_EVENT_3124
register.comment: When the timer matches this count a deep sleep wakeup event will be triggered - bits 31-24

register.name: SLOW_CLK_TIMER_EVENT_2316
register.comment: When the timer matches this count a deep sleep wakeup event will be triggered - bits 23-16

register.name: SLOW_CLK_TIMER_EVENT_1508
register.comment: When the timer matches this count a deep sleep wakeup event will be triggered - bits 15-8

register.name: SLOW_CLK_TIMER_EVENT_0700
register.comment: When the timer matches this count a deep sleep wakeup event will be triggered - bits 7-0

register.name: DEBUG_SOURCE_SELECT
register.comment: Select the ouput on DEBUG_OUT[15:0] on the PMU

register.name: PCM_AUDIO_GAIN_I0
register.comment: Pad data when padding 13 bits to 16 bits (bottom 3 bits valid)

register.name: PCM_RX_SLOT_CFG_I0
register.comment: Re-sample (under-sample) incoming PCM Data stream. 0: no under sampling, 1: 2-]1 2: 3-]1 ...16-]1

register.name: PCM_TX_SLOT_CFG_I0
register.comment: Re-sample (over-sample) outgoing PCM Data stream. 0: no over sampling; 1: 1-]2; 2: 1-]3 ... 1-]16

register.name: PCM_TX_SLOT_ALIGN_CFG_I0
register.comment: When enabled Aligns the PCM slots with the correct buffers

register.name: PCM_RX_SLOT_ALIGN_CFG_I0
register.comment: When enabled Aligns the PCM slots with the correct buffers

register.name: PCM_SLOT_ROUTING_I0
register.comment: Routes which slots go to which FIFO

register.name: PCM_TOP_DEBUG_SEL_I0
register.comment: Top level Debug bus select for PCM

register.name: PCM_FIFO_SIZE_I0[0]
register.comment: Reads back how full the FIFO is (in bytes not samples).

register.name: PCM_FIFO_SIZE_I0[1]
register.comment: Reads back how full the FIFO is (in bytes not samples).

register.name: PCM_FIFO_SIZE_I0[2]
register.comment: Reads back how full the FIFO is (in bytes not samples).

register.name: PCM_FIFO_SIZE_I0[3]
register.comment: Reads back how full the FIFO is (in bytes not samples).

register.name: PCM_FIFO_SIZE_I0[4]
register.comment: Reads back how full the FIFO is (in bytes not samples).

register.name: PCM_FIFO_SIZE_I0[5]
register.comment: Reads back how full the FIFO is (in bytes not samples).

register.name: PCM_FIFO_WATER_MARK_I0[0]
register.comment: Sets the level (in bytes) when interrupts are generated.

register.name: PCM_FIFO_WATER_MARK_I0[1]
register.comment: Sets the level (in bytes) when interrupts are generated.

register.name: PCM_FIFO_WATER_MARK_I0[2]
register.comment: Sets the level (in bytes) when interrupts are generated.

register.name: PCM_FIFO_WATER_MARK_I0[3]
register.comment: Sets the level (in bytes) when interrupts are generated.

register.name: PCM_FIFO_WATER_MARK_I0[4]
register.comment: Sets the level (in bytes) when interrupts are generated.

register.name: PCM_FIFO_WATER_MARK_I0[5]
register.comment: Sets the level (in bytes) when interrupts are generated.

register.name: PCM_INT_CLEAR_I0
register.comment: Clear Interrupt Sources by writing a 1 to the register bit.

register.name: PCM_INT_WATER_EN_I0
register.comment: Interrupt sources enable for the water mark indicators.

register.name: PCM_INT_WATER_CLEAR_I0
register.comment: Clear Interrupt Sources by writing a 1 to the register bit.

register.name: PCM_FIFO_WIDTH_I0
register.comment: Sets the width of each FIFO

register.name: PCM_FIFO_CMD_I0
register.comment: A set of instructions for the manulipation of FIFO's

register.name: PCM_AUDIO_GAIN_I1
register.comment: Pad data when padding 13 bits to 16 bits (bottom 3 bits valid)

register.name: PCM_RX_SLOT_CFG_I1
register.comment: Re-sample (under-sample) incoming PCM Data stream. 0: no under sampling, 1: 2-]1 2: 3-]1 ...16-]1

register.name: PCM_TX_SLOT_CFG_I1
register.comment: Re-sample (over-sample) outgoing PCM Data stream. 0: no over sampling; 1: 1-]2; 2: 1-]3 ... 1-]16

register.name: PCM_TX_SLOT_ALIGN_CFG_I1
register.comment: When enabled Aligns the PCM slots with the correct buffers

register.name: PCM_RX_SLOT_ALIGN_CFG_I1
register.comment: When enabled Aligns the PCM slots with the correct buffers

register.name: PCM_SLOT_ROUTING_I1
register.comment: Routes which slots go to which FIFO

register.name: PCM_TOP_DEBUG_SEL_I1
register.comment: Top level Debug bus select for PCM

register.name: PCM_FIFO_SIZE_I1[0]
register.comment: Reads back how full the FIFO is (in bytes not samples).

register.name: PCM_FIFO_SIZE_I1[1]
register.comment: Reads back how full the FIFO is (in bytes not samples).

register.name: PCM_FIFO_SIZE_I1[2]
register.comment: Reads back how full the FIFO is (in bytes not samples).

register.name: PCM_FIFO_SIZE_I1[3]
register.comment: Reads back how full the FIFO is (in bytes not samples).

register.name: PCM_FIFO_SIZE_I1[4]
register.comment: Reads back how full the FIFO is (in bytes not samples).

register.name: PCM_FIFO_SIZE_I1[5]
register.comment: Reads back how full the FIFO is (in bytes not samples).

register.name: PCM_FIFO_WATER_MARK_I1[0]
register.comment: Sets the level (in bytes) when interrupts are generated.

register.name: PCM_FIFO_WATER_MARK_I1[1]
register.comment: Sets the level (in bytes) when interrupts are generated.

register.name: PCM_FIFO_WATER_MARK_I1[2]
register.comment: Sets the level (in bytes) when interrupts are generated.

register.name: PCM_FIFO_WATER_MARK_I1[3]
register.comment: Sets the level (in bytes) when interrupts are generated.

register.name: PCM_FIFO_WATER_MARK_I1[4]
register.comment: Sets the level (in bytes) when interrupts are generated.

register.name: PCM_FIFO_WATER_MARK_I1[5]
register.comment: Sets the level (in bytes) when interrupts are generated.

register.name: PCM_INT_CLEAR_I1
register.comment: Clear Interrupt Sources by writing a 1 to the register bit.

register.name: PCM_INT_WATER_EN_I1
register.comment: Interrupt sources enable for the water mark indicators.

register.name: PCM_INT_WATER_CLEAR_I1
register.comment: Clear Interrupt Sources by writing a 1 to the register bit.

register.name: PCM_FIFO_WIDTH_I1
register.comment: Sets the width of each FIFO

register.name: PCM_FIFO_CMD_I1
register.comment: A set of instructions for the manulipation of FIFO's

register.name: PCR_VERSION
register.comment: Connected to CHIP_VERSION_ID from the pmu_remap register block.

register.name: PCR_PERI_REGISTER_HASH
register.comment: Contains a 32bit hash of all the PERI register tree source used in the IP

register.name: PCR_RTC_IRQ_EN
register.comment: RTC Interrupt enable. Any writes to this register also clear any RTC interrupt.

register.name: PCR_WL_DAC0_CTR_CM
register.comment: Bit [23] is OR'd with WL_RADIO_TX_DAC_EN, so don't set [23] to 1 in this register unless you want to force it on.

register.name: PCR_WL_DAC1_CTR_CM
register.comment: Bit [23] is OR'd with WL_RADIO_TX_DAC_EN, so don't set [23] to 1 in this register unless you want to force it on.

register.name: PCR_QOS
register.comment: Quality of service values for the NIC-400 matrix AXI masters.

register.name: PCR_RMP_RGN0_BOOT
register.comment: PROC0 Boot Address Remapping Region 0 Enable

register.name: PCR_RMP_RGN_BASE[0]
register.comment: PROC0 Address Remapping Region N Start Address (4K address)

register.name: PCR_RMP_RGN_BASE[1]
register.comment: PROC0 Address Remapping Region N Start Address (4K address)

register.name: PCR_RMP_RGN_BASE[2]
register.comment: PROC0 Address Remapping Region N Start Address (4K address)

register.name: PCR_RMP_RGN_BASE[3]
register.comment: PROC0 Address Remapping Region N Start Address (4K address)

register.name: PCR_RMP_RGN_BASE[4]
register.comment: PROC0 Address Remapping Region N Start Address (4K address)

register.name: PCR_RMP_RGN_BASE[5]
register.comment: PROC0 Address Remapping Region N Start Address (4K address)

register.name: PCR_RMP_RGN_SIZE[0]
register.comment: PROC0 Address Remapping Region N Size (multiples of 4K bytes)

register.name: PCR_RMP_RGN_SIZE[1]
register.comment: PROC0 Address Remapping Region N Size (multiples of 4K bytes)

register.name: PCR_RMP_RGN_SIZE[2]
register.comment: PROC0 Address Remapping Region N Size (multiples of 4K bytes)

register.name: PCR_RMP_RGN_SIZE[3]
register.comment: PROC0 Address Remapping Region N Size (multiples of 4K bytes)

register.name: PCR_RMP_RGN_SIZE[4]
register.comment: PROC0 Address Remapping Region N Size (multiples of 4K bytes)

register.name: PCR_RMP_RGN_SIZE[5]
register.comment: PROC0 Address Remapping Region N Size (multiples of 4K bytes)

register.name: PCR_RMP_RGN_OFST[0]
register.comment: PROC0 Address Remapping Region N Offset (4K bytes)

register.name: PCR_RMP_RGN_OFST[1]
register.comment: PROC0 Address Remapping Region N Offset (4K bytes)

register.name: PCR_RMP_RGN_OFST[2]
register.comment: PROC0 Address Remapping Region N Offset (4K bytes)

register.name: PCR_RMP_RGN_OFST[3]
register.comment: PROC0 Address Remapping Region N Offset (4K bytes)

register.name: PCR_RMP_RGN_OFST[4]
register.comment: PROC0 Address Remapping Region N Offset (4K bytes)

register.name: PCR_RMP_RGN_OFST[5]
register.comment: PROC0 Address Remapping Region N Offset (4K bytes)

register.name: PCR_QREQ_OFF_XDMA
register.comment: XDMA Q-channel override. Setting to '1' overrides the Q-channel clock gating and forces the clock gate on.

register.name: PCR_DRAM_EARLY_WAKEUP
register.comment: DRAM early wakeup counter setting. When this changes from zero to non-zero this triggers the logic to capture the new non-zero value.

register.name: PCR_FLEXI_PROC_POR_RESET
register.comment: FlexiMac processor power-on reset software control. This resets all of the M3 logic.

register.name: PCR_FLEXI_PROC_SYS_RESET
register.comment: FlexiMac processor sys reset control. This resets just the core logic, not the debug logic.

register.name: PCR_FLEXI_MTX_CLOCK_EN
register.comment: FlexiMac processor platform interconnect matrix clock enables.

register.name: PCR_QEXP
register.comment: Q-channel controller clock gate enable timeouts, measured in clock cycles. The number of clock cycles to extend the outgoing clock gate enable after the incoming active signal is deasserted.

register.name: PCR_SIM_MAILBOX[0]
register.comment: Handy registers to make simulation testing much easier. Can be directly used in FPGAs for debug.

register.name: PCR_SIM_MAILBOX[1]
register.comment: Handy registers to make simulation testing much easier. Can be directly used in FPGAs for debug.

register.name: PCR_SIM_MAILBOX[2]
register.comment: Handy registers to make simulation testing much easier. Can be directly used in FPGAs for debug.

register.name: PCR_SIM_MAILBOX[3]
register.comment: Handy registers to make simulation testing much easier. Can be directly used in FPGAs for debug.

register.name: PCR_SIM_MAILBOX[4]
register.comment: Handy registers to make simulation testing much easier. Can be directly used in FPGAs for debug.

register.name: PCR_SIM_MAILBOX[5]
register.comment: Handy registers to make simulation testing much easier. Can be directly used in FPGAs for debug.

register.name: PCR_SIM_MAILBOX[6]
register.comment: Handy registers to make simulation testing much easier. Can be directly used in FPGAs for debug.

register.name: PCR_SIM_MAILBOX[7]
register.comment: Handy registers to make simulation testing much easier. Can be directly used in FPGAs for debug.

register.name: PCR_REGS_FAILED_ADDRESS
register.comment: Address of last register access that failed to complete successfully, usually resulting in a CPU abort of some sort.

register.name: PCR_REGS_STATUS
register.comment: Observe the register bus failure status. Write to a field to clear it.

register.name: RANDOM_NUMBER
register.comment: Random number. Enable generation by setting CLOCK_ENABLE_40_RAND to '1'.

register.name: PCR_PMU_IPC_INT
register.comment: Inter-processor interrupt signal to the PMU. Nothing fancy, just a single bit you set high or low. Usually setting it high will generate an interrupt in the PMU but that depends how the PMU works. You'll need to de-assert it once the PMU has received the interrupt so some sort of protocol should be arranged.

register.name: MIF_AXI_READ_REJECT_EN
register.comment: Enable the block which prevents out-of-range MIF accesses going to the SOC and causing ITMON reports. This block intercepts the error address AXI transactions, stops them reaching the MIF longhop, and returns the appropriate number of error-laden read response beats for that burst.

register.name: FREQ_COUNT_STATUS
register.comment: Check the status and results of frequency counter.

register.name: PCR_SEMAPHORE[0]
register.comment: Array of single bit semaphore registers.

register.name: PCR_SEMAPHORE[1]
register.comment: Array of single bit semaphore registers.

register.name: PCR_SEMAPHORE[2]
register.comment: Array of single bit semaphore registers.

register.name: PCR_SEMAPHORE[3]
register.comment: Array of single bit semaphore registers.

register.name: PCR_MAC_IF_PREFETCHER_FLUSH
register.comment: Write '1' to a bit to cause the appropriate MAC IF prefetcher block to invalidate the contents of its prefetch buffer.

register.name: PCR_ETM_EXT_ENABLE_MASK
register.comment: Bitfield. Enable bit(s) to allow the ETM EXT bus from the R7 to propagate to the CoreSight block..

register.name: TCKR_SET_VALUE
register.comment: Set a new value of the ticker

register.name: TCKR_ALARM[0]
register.comment: Set the Proc alarm value. As a side effect - clears the corresponding interrupt line

register.name: TCKR_ALARM[1]
register.comment: Set the Proc alarm value. As a side effect - clears the corresponding interrupt line

register.name: TCKR_ALARM[2]
register.comment: Set the Proc alarm value. As a side effect - clears the corresponding interrupt line

register.name: TCKR_ALARM[3]
register.comment: Set the Proc alarm value. As a side effect - clears the corresponding interrupt line

register.name: TCKR_ALARM[4]
register.comment: Set the Proc alarm value. As a side effect - clears the corresponding interrupt line

register.name: TCKR_TIMESTAMP_OCCURRED
register.comment: Timestamp edge has happened (one bit for each block)

register.name: TCKR_CLK_SCALE
register.comment: Ticker clock scale value. Should be the same as the ticker clock frequency in MHz as that produces a strobe every 1us.

register.name: PIO_INVERT_ENABLES
register.comment: Set a bit to 1 to invert the driven output.

register.name: DEBUG_DESERIALISER_CFG
register.comment: Configuration for the RFIC debug de-serialisers

register.name: DEBUG_DESERIALISER_CFG2
register.comment: Second configuration register for the RFIC debug de-serialisers

register.name: DEBUG_DESERIALISER_CFG3
register.comment: Third configuration register for the RFIC debug de-serialisers

register.name: DEBUG_DESERIALISER_CFG4
register.comment: Fourth configuration register for the RFIC debug de-serialisers

register.name: DEBUG_DESERIALISER_ERROR_COUNTER_8B10B_DECODE
register.comment: Count of errors since last cleared

register.name: DEBUG_DESERIALISER_ERROR_COUNTER_8B10B_SYNC
register.comment: Count of errors since last cleared

register.name: DEBUG_DESERIALISER_ERROR_COUNTER_8B10B_DISP
register.comment: Count of errors since last cleared

register.name: DEBUG_DESERIALISER_ERROR_COUNTER_8B10B_CRC
register.comment: Count of errors since last cleared

register.name: DEBUG_DESERIALISER_STATUS
register.comment: Status register for the RFIC debug de-serialisers

register.name: DEBUG_DESERIALISER_MONITOR
register.comment: Monitor register for the RFIC debug de-serialisers

block.name: wl_mac_0
block.comment: WLan MAC top level registers and enumerations for 802.11 protocol, Commands and Indications

register.name: CLKGEN_MAC_ENABLES_I0
register.comment: This register enables clocks for MAC

register.name: MAC_DEBUG_SEL_I0
register.comment: Select MAC debug port output (this is in addition to MAC IF and MAC ACC ports)

block.name: wl_mac_1
block.comment: WLan MAC top level registers and enumerations for 802.11 protocol, Commands and Indications

register.name: CLKGEN_MAC_ENABLES_I1
register.comment: This register enables clocks for MAC

register.name: MAC_DEBUG_SEL_I1
register.comment: Select MAC debug port output (this is in addition to MAC IF and MAC ACC ports)

register.name: WL_DEBUG_SEL
register.comment: Select for WLan_pd level debug mux

register.name: WL_DEBUG_COMB_POSN_3_0
register.comment: Select for WLan_pd level debug mux

register.name: WL_DEBUG_COMB_POSN_7_4
register.comment: Select for WLan_pd level debug mux

register.name: WL_DEBUG_COMB_POSN_11_8
register.comment: Select for WLan_pd level debug mux

register.name: WL_DEBUG_COMB_POSN_15_12
register.comment: Select for WLan_pd level debug mux

register.name: WL_DEBUG_COMB_BUS_0_SEL
register.comment: Source bus select for intermediate bus 0 (select one of up to 32 busses)

register.name: WL_DEBUG_COMB_BUS_1_SEL
register.comment: Source bus select for intermediate bus 1 (select one of up to 32 busses)

register.name: WL_DEBUG_COMB_BUS_2_SEL
register.comment: Source bus select for intermediate bus 2 (select one of up to 32 busses)

register.name: WL_DEBUG_COMB_BUS_3_SEL
register.comment: Source bus select for intermediate bus 3 (select one of up to 32 busses)

register.name: XDMAC_INT_TC_CLR_I0
register.comment: Transfer Complete Interrupt Clear Register (Value is not meaningful)

register.name: XDMAC_INT_TC_MASK_I0
register.comment: Transfer Complete Interrupt Mask Register (0: Interrupt disabled, 1 : Interrupt enabled)

register.name: XDMAC_START_I0
register.comment: DMA Transfer Start (Value is not meaningful). Do NOT start DMA again until the previously started DMA transfer is completed.

register.name: XDMAC_ICG_DISABLE_I0
register.comment: Internal clock gating is disabled (0 : Clock gating enabled, 1 : Clock gatingdisabled)

register.name: XDMAC_LLI_NXT_ADDR_I0
register.comment: Next Address Register to indicate the next linked list item (Linked List Item)

register.name: XDMAC_INT_TC_CLR_I1
register.comment: Transfer Complete Interrupt Clear Register (Value is not meaningful)

register.name: XDMAC_INT_TC_MASK_I1
register.comment: Transfer Complete Interrupt Mask Register (0: Interrupt disabled, 1 : Interrupt enabled)

register.name: XDMAC_START_I1
register.comment: DMA Transfer Start (Value is not meaningful). Do NOT start DMA again until the previously started DMA transfer is completed.

register.name: XDMAC_ICG_DISABLE_I1
register.comment: Internal clock gating is disabled (0 : Clock gating enabled, 1 : Clock gatingdisabled)

register.name: XDMAC_LLI_NXT_ADDR_I1
register.comment: Next Address Register to indicate the next linked list item (Linked List Item)

block.name: zippy_bb
block.comment: ZIPPY BB control and status registers

register.name: ZIPPY_BB_ADDR_CTRL
register.comment: ZIPPY remote register access address and controls. The bottom 16 bits of this register (PSEL and ADDR) are actually the bottom 16 bits of the byte address of the RFIC register to be accessed (from HTML docs for example)

register.name: ZIPPY_BB_WRITE_DATA
register.comment: Data to write to remote register over ZIPPY. Only the number of bytes specified in the ZIPPY_BB_WIDTH field are transferred. Unwritten bytes are unchanged, if the destination register is larger than the number of bytes written

register.name: ZIPPY_BB_READ_DATA
register.comment: Data returned from the remote register over ZIPPY. Only the number of bytes specified in the ZIPPY_BB_WIDTH field are transferred

register.name: ZIPPY_BB_TIMEOUTS
register.comment: Time out control for register read data and write acknowledges (if enabled) to be returned from the RF IC

register.name: ZIPPY_BB_TRANSPORT
register.comment: ZIPPY baseband transport configuration. The matching configuration must also be set up in the RF chip

register.name: ZIPPY_BB_PRIORITY_INC_RATE
register.comment: Configure the rate at which priority increases for unserviced channels.

register.name: ZIPPY_BB_DATA_CFG
register.comment: Address/data frame configuration and write ack mask

register.name: ZIPPY_BB_INT_CLEAR
register.comment: Clear Interrupt Sources by writing a 1 to the register bit.

register.name: ZIPPY_BB_APB_STATUS
register.comment: Status of the RF IC register access

register.name: ZIPPY_BB_DATA_COUNTS
register.comment: Local BB counters for data from BB to RF and RF to BB. TO be compared with equivalent ones in the RFIC

register.name: ZIPPY_BB_DEBUG_CTRL
register.comment: Control of Zippy debug and logging facilities

register.name: ZIPPY_BB_WINDOW_TIMER_0
register.comment: Sets the window count down timer (in clock ticks).

register.name: ZIPPY_BB_WINDOW_PRE_RESV_0
register.comment: Sets the window Start of the Pre-Reservation window.

register.name: ZIPPY_BB_WINDOW_RESV_0
register.comment: Sets the window Start of the Reservation window.

register.name: ZIPPY_BB_WINDOW_TIMER_1
register.comment: Sets the window count down timer (in clock ticks).

register.name: ZIPPY_BB_WINDOW_PRE_RESV_1
register.comment: Sets the window Start of the Pre-Reservation window.

register.name: ZIPPY_BB_WINDOW_RESV_1
register.comment: Sets the window Start of the Reservation window.
